about.summary: Evaluate arbitrary function calls using workers on HPC schedulers in single line of code. All processing is done on the network without accessing the file system. Remote schedulers are supported via SSH.

name: r-clustermq
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.8.9" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-clustermq
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/clustermq_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/clustermq/clustermq_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 8b580fd2d15c1b8558ee8fe3d254eb77a95aea4d7daeb58e1c51f59d60380b89

build:
  merge_build_host: true  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-r6
    - r-narray
    - r-progress
    - r-purrr
    - r-rzmq >=0.9.4
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-r6
    - r-narray
    - r-progress
    - r-purrr
    - r-rzmq >=0.9.4

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('clustermq')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('clustermq')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/mschubert/clustermq
  license: Apache 2.0
  summary: Evaluate arbitrary function calls using workers on HPC schedulers in single line of code. All processing is done on the network without accessing the file
    system. Remote schedulers are supported via SSH.
  license_family: APACHE
  license_file:
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - nick-youngblut

# Package: clustermq
# Title: Evaluate Function Calls on HPC Schedulers (LSF, SGE, SLURM, PBS/Torque)
# Version: 0.8.8.1
# Authors@R: c( person('Michael', 'Schubert', email='mschu.dev@gmail.com', role = c('aut', 'cre', 'cph'), comment = c(ORCID='0000-0002-6862-5221') ), person('EMBL', role = c('cph', 'fnd')) )
# Maintainer: Michael Schubert <mschu.dev@gmail.com>
# Description: Evaluate arbitrary function calls using workers on HPC schedulers in single line of code. All processing is done on the network without accessing the file system. Remote schedulers are supported via SSH.
# URL: https://github.com/mschubert/clustermq
# BugReports: https://github.com/mschubert/clustermq/issues
# Depends: R (>= 3.0.2)
# Imports: narray, progress, purrr, R6, rzmq (>= 0.9.4), utils
# License: Apache License (== 2.0) | file LICENSE
# LazyData: true
# Encoding: UTF-8
# Suggests: devtools, dplyr, foreach, iterators, knitr, parallel, roxygen2 (>= 5.0.0), testthat, tools
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-12-18 08:29:04 UTC; mschu
# Author: Michael Schubert [aut, cre, cph] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6862-5221>), EMBL [cph, fnd]
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-12-18 10:10:02 UTC
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
